p: Fig 5 shows that red propolis extracts (tested at a concentration of 50 μg.mL -1) altered the viability of the investigated cell lines ( Fig 5A–5D), with a significant reduction (p<0.05) at the final cell concentration (except for the D2 extract against the HL60 line). Franchi et al. [ 145] comparatively evaluated propolis extracts of different types and geographical origins and found a higher antiproliferative activity for the extracts obtained from the red propolis samples, evidencing the high biological potential of this matrix due mainly to its differentiated composition. Machado et al. [ 146] evaluated the chemical composition and biological activity of yellow, green, brown, and red Brazilian propolis and found the highest selectivity against all tumor cells was shown by red propolis especially against HL60.
